title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent In Sunnyside, Queens

content.rendered:
Renting an apartment in New York City is anything but cheap. And because of the high demand and low supply, it’s not getting any cheaper anytime soon. Luckily, there are still a few neighbourhoods where you can find affordable apartments to rent, and the Sunnyside neighbourhood in Queens is one of them. If you’re looking for an affordable place to live in New York City, you’ll want to go through this post. We’ll tell you everything you need to know about rooms for rent in Sunnyside and why it’s so great to live here!

1. Where is Sunnyside?

Sunnyside is a neighbourhood in the western part of the Queens borough of New York City. It is bordered on the west by Hunters Point and Long Island City, on the north by Astoria, on the east by Woodside, and on the south by Maspeth. It’s home to the Sunnyside Gardens Historic District, one of the first planned communities in the United States, and a swift commute to Manhattan is just one of the reasons why you should be looking for rooms for rent in Sunnyside is a great idea!

2. Find rooms for rent in Sunnyside

Find Rooms For Rent In Sunnyside, Queens

Sunnyside is home to many professionals looking for a big city experience without giving up their suburban comforts. It has many amenities such as parks, restaurants, and a library. You can find rooms for rent in Sunnyside with ease because it’s close to Manhattan but far enough away from all the hustle and bustle that comes with living in the city.

Related: Guide For The First Time Renter

3. Average Rent in Sunnyside

The area’s housing stock for apartments is dominated by six-story pre-war apartment buildings, however, the neighbourhood also has a small-town atmosphere thanks to the abundance of beautiful private brick houses with private front yards.

Sunnyside’s housing expenses are significantly below Manhattan, Brooklyn, and Queens, with an average rent in Sunnyside of $1,630 and an average sales asking price of $557,936 as of August 2021. The money you save by living here is going to come in very handy when you’re eating at your favourite restaurants in Sunnyside! Still in doubt? Check out the average rent in Sunnyside:

Related: Roomie Advice From Joey and Chandler

4. Is Sunnyside safe?

The 108th Precinct of the New York Police Department, situated at 5-47 50th Avenue, patrols Woodside, Sunnyside, and Long Island City. In terms of per-capita crime, the 108th Precinct was rated 25th out of 69 patrol districts. Sunnyside and Woodside’s rate of violent crimes per capita is less than that of the city, which is an important factor to consider when you’re looking for rooms for rent in Sunnyside.

Hotline numbers: The NYCD’s website lists many different services that you may access by calling 311. Abandoned vehicles, road upkeep, noise complaints, and graffiti can all be reported. Call 911 in any case involving urgent danger.

5. Public Transit in Sunnyside

If you’re looking for an area that combines a small-town feel with big-city accessibility, this friendly New York City neighbourhood offers both. Located just 15 minutes from Midtown Manhattan, Sunnyside, Queens, is a diverse and affordable neighbourhood that residents love and housing-seekers shouldn’t ignore. With seven stations serving the area — and bus lines for those who want to avoid crowded subway cars — residents love how easy it is to get around.

Walkability

Sunnyside 44-44 Queens Boulevard has a Walk Score of 98 out of 100. According to Walk Score, this location is a Walker’s Paradise, so definitely don’t need a car to get around town and run your daily errands.

Nearby Bus Station

Sunnyside has five bus stations with fairly frequent buses. The bus station in Sunnyside are on Queens Blvd, which are on 48th street, 46th street and 39th Pl.

Nearby Train Station

Wondering how to get from Sunnyside to Manhattan? The 7 Train stops at Grand Central, Fifth Avenue, and Times Square, and all three of these stations are transfer hubs that connect to many other lines throughout the city.

Roads and Traffic

With good connectivity and excellent road conditions, Sunnyside doesn’t face much traffic outside of peak hours. Here is a live map of the roads and traffic conditions of Sunnyside so you can plan your trip when you’re searching for rooms for rent in Sunnyside, NYC.

Related: Hacks To The Subway In NYC We All Need

6. Restaurants in Sunnyside

There are loads of restaurants in Sunnyside and a tonne of stores along Queens Boulevard, but if you want to get away from the crowds, Skillman and 43rd Avenues have plenty of quaint cafés, restaurants, and other establishments. From Korean BBQs and empanada joints to Peruvian chicken spots, Irish pubs, Nepalese bento boxes and meaty Romanian fare, there’s something for everyone here. Here are a few restaurants in Sunnyside for you to explore while you’re looking for rooms for rent in Sunnyside.

  • Cemitas El Tigre – This is your contemporary counter-served stop for 10-layer Mexican sandwiches, plus burritos, tacos and beer.
  • Los Pollos – You can find Delicious Peruvian Fusion from a family-owned business located in the heart of Sunnyside.
  • Takesushi – This charming restaurant specializes in traditional Japanese food and has daily lunch specials.

7. Parks in Sunnyside

A lack of green space compared to other neighbourhoods is perhaps one of the few complaints you’ll hear from Sunnyside residents. However, the members-only park in Sunnyside does provide those willing to pay an annual fee with three acres of ball courts (including tennis courts) and playing fields.

Sunnyside Gardens Park: This is a members-only park in Sunnyside. This is the perfect place to kick back and enjoy some family time, sport or time with your furry friends.

Public Parks in Sunnyside include:

  • Thomas P. Noonan Playground, located between Greenpoint Avenue, 42nd Avenue, 43rd Street, and 47th Streets.
  • Torsney Playground, located at Skillman Avenue and 43rd Street.
  • Sabba Park, located in the median of Queens Boulevard between 48th Street and 49th Street.

8. Other Attractions in Sunnyside

While you’re looking for rooms for rent in Sunnyside, here are some other attractions you’ve gotta check out!

Thalia Hispanic Theater: This is Queens’ only Latin theatre where you can immerse yourself in the Latin community’s vibrant culture. Be sure to check out their virtual performances as well.

Stray Vintage: Shop for vintage furniture, salvaged items, and antique goods in this neighbourhood mainstay.

Drunk Shakespeare: An unusual and entertaining theatre event in which one professional actor drinks five shots of whiskey and tries to act in a Shakespearean play.

Please Don’t Tell – This local speakeasy is a one-of-a-kind spot to unwind and sip drinks. But shhh — keep it a secret!

VR World NYC: This fascinating attraction demonstrates the finest of mixed reality and virtual reality. You’ll interact with art, movies, and gaming, and there are some great cocktails at the bar as well!

Queens Public Library –The Queens Public Library, commonly known as the Queens Borough Public Library and the Queens Library, serves New York City and is one of the world’s largest library systems.

Did you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find rooms for rent in Sunnyside? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!

DOWNLOAD THE APP NOW!
